alert.note: Alert for Surry (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 1:56PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Surry County through 230 PM EDT... At 156 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dobson, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Airy... Fairview... Flat Rock... Dobson... Pilot Mountain... Bottom... and Mountain Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
